verses.verse: Let them ((Ex. 32:32); Phil. 4:3; (Rev. 3:5; 13:8)) be blotted out of the book of the living, (Ezek. 13:9; Luke 10:20; Heb. 12:23) And not be written with the righteous.
But I am poor and sorrowful; Let Your salvation, O God, set me up on high.
((Ps. 28:7)) I will praise the name of God with a song, And will magnify Him with thanksgiving.
(Ps. 50:13, 14, 23; 51:16) This also shall please the LORD better than an ox or bull, Which has horns and hooves.
(Ps. 34:2) The humble shall see this and be glad; And you who seek God, (Ps. 22:26) your hearts shall live.
For the LORD hears the poor, And does not despise ((Ps. 68:6); Eph. 3:1) His prisoners.
(Ps. 96:11; Is. 44:23; 49:13) Let heaven and earth praise Him, The seas (Is. 55:12) and everything that moves in them.
(Ps. 51:18; Is. 44:26) For God will save Zion And build the cities of Judah, That they may dwell there and possess it.
Also, (Ps. 102:28) the descendants of His servants shall inherit it, And those who love His name shall dwell in it.

(Prayer for Relief from Adversaries) To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. (Ps. 38:title) To bring to remembrance. [1] Make haste, (Ps. 40:13-17) O God, to deliver me! Make haste to help me, O LORD!
(Ps. 35:4, 26) Let them be ashamed and confounded Who seek my life; Let them be turned back and confused Who desire my hurt.
(Ps. 40:15) Let them be turned back because of their shame, Who say, “Aha, aha!”
Let all those who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; And let those who love Your salvation say continually, “Let God be magnified!”
(Ps. 72:12, 13) But I am poor and needy; (Ps. 141:1) Make haste to me, O God! You are my help and my deliverer; O LORD, do not delay.
(God the Rock of Salvation) In (Ps. 25:2, 3) You, O LORD, I put my trust; Let me never be put to shame.
(Ps. 31:1) Deliver me in Your righteousness, and cause me to escape; (Ps. 17:6) Incline Your ear to me, and save me.
(Ps. 31:2, 3) Be my strong refuge, To which I may resort continually; You have given the (Ps. 44:4) commandment to save me, For You are my rock and my fortress.
(Ps. 140:1, 3) Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, Out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
For You are (Jer. 14:8; 17:7, 13, 17; 50:7) my hope, O Lord GOD; You are my trust from my youth.
(Ps. 22:9, 10; Is. 46:3) By You I have been upheld from birth; You are He who took me out of my mother’s womb. My praise shall be continually of You.
(Is. 8:18; Zech. 3:8; 1 Cor. 4:9) I have become as a wonder to many, But You are my strong refuge.
Let (Ps. 35:28) my mouth be filled with Your praise And with Your glory all the day.
Do not cast me off in the time of old age; Do not forsake me when my strength fails.
For my enemies speak against me; And those who lie in wait for my life (2 Sam. 17:1) take counsel together,
